Detailed Description

header file for motor.c, functions to control the HR20 motor

Author:
Dario Carluccio <hr20-at-carluccio-dot-de>
Date:
07.02.2008
Rev
112

Define Documentation

#define MOTOR_FULL_PWM   95

duty cycle of PWM in normal mode

#define MOTOR_HR20_PB4   PB4

if PWM output != OC0A you have a problem

#define MOTOR_HR20_PB4_P   PORTB

Port for PWM output.

#define MOTOR_HR20_PB7   PB7

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HR20_PB7_P   PORTB

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HR20_PE3   PE3

HR20: pin to activate photo eye.

#define MOTOR_HR20_PE3_P   PORTE

HR20: port to activate photo eye.

#define MOTOR_HR20_PE_IN   PE4

HR20: input pin from photo eye.

#define MOTOR_HR20_PE_IN_P   PINE

HR20: input port from photo eye.

#define MOTOR_HR20_PG3   PG3

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HR20_PG3_P   PORTG

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HR20_PG4   PG4

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HR20_PG4_P   PORTG

change this for other hardware e.g. HR40

#define MOTOR_HYSTERESIS   50

additional impulses for 0 or 100%

#define MOTOR_MAX_IMPULSES   1000

How many photoeye impulses maximal form one endposition to the other.


The value measured on a HR20 are 820 to 900 = so more than 1000 should never occure if it is mounted

#define MOTOR_QUIET_PWM   70

duty cycle of PWM in quiet mode

Function Documentation

bool MOTOR_Calibrate ( uint8_t  percent,
motor_speed_t  speed 
)

calibrate the motor and drive it to position in percent \ returns

  • true if calibration successfull
  • false if not successfull possible reasons:
    • motor is not stopped after MOTOR_MAX_IMPULSES impulses
    • motor has been dismounted

Parameters:
percent desired position after calibration 0-100
  • 0 : closed
  • 100 : open
speed motorspeed in percent for PWM
Note:
minimises motor time (save power)

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void MOTOR_CheckBlocked ( void   ) 

check if motor is blocked

Note:
stops the motor if blocked

checks if MOTOR_PosAct == MOTOR_PosLast

must be called at least every 1s
not quicker than 500ms

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void MOTOR_Control ( motor_dir_t  direction,
motor_speed_t  speed 
)

controll motor movement

Parameters:
direction motordirection
  • stop
  • ope
  • close
speed motorspeed
  • full (MOTOR_FULL_PWM /100) * 255
  • quiet (MOTOR_QUIET_PWM /100) * 255
speed motorspeed in percent for PWM
Note:
PWM runs at 15,625 kHz

Output for direction: 

     direction  PG3  PG4  PB7  PB4/PWM(OC0A)    PE3    PCINT4
       stop:     0    0    0    0                0      off
       open:     0    1    1   invert. mode      1      on
       close:    1    0    0   non inv mode      1      on

Here is the caller graph for this function:

uint8_t MOTOR_GetPosPercent ( void   ) 

Returns:
  • actual position of motor in percent
  • 255 if motor is not calibrated

Here is the caller graph for this function:

bool MOTOR_Goto ( uint8_t  percent,
motor_speed_t  speed 
)

drive motor to desired position in percent

Parameters:
percent desired endposition 0-100
  • 0 : closed
  • 100 : open
speed motorspeed in percent for PWM
Note:
works only if calibrated before
